Package moulton.scalable.containers

Class ListPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
      • moulton.scalable.containers.Panel
        • moulton.scalable.containers.PanelPlus
          • moulton.scalable.containers.ListPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScrollableComponent
    public class ListPanel
extends PanelPlus
    A subclass of PanelPlus. Built to hold a variable number of elements in the list. These elements must be of type MenuComponent, whether they be panels or individual components. Elements can be added when components set their parent, which thereby calls addComponent(MenuComponent, int). Elements can be removed from the list by removeComponent(int, boolean). All components can be removed from the list by clearComponents(). The length of the list may be ascertained by getListLength().
    Author:
    Matthew Moulton

    • Field Detail

      • rowHeight

        protected java.lang.String rowHeight
        The height of each row specified by an algebraic expression.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListPanel

        public ListPanel​(java.lang.String rowHeight,
                 Panel parent,
                 java.lang.String x,
                 java.lang.String y,
                 java.lang.String shownWidth,
                 java.lang.String shownHeight,
                 java.lang.String fullWidth,
                 java.awt.Color color)
        Parameters:
        rowHeight - the height of each row, specified as an algebraic expression of a menu component
        parent - the panel this panel will reside upon.
        x - the x coordinate on the screen, given in menu component value format
        y - the y coordinate on the screen, given in menu component value format
        shownWidth - the component width that will be displayed, given in menu component value format
        shownHeight - the component height that will be displayed, given in menu component value format
        fullWidth - the entire width of the panel. In general, intended to be greater than shownWidth
        color - the background color for the box when editable

      • ListPanel

        public ListPanel​(java.lang.String rowHeight,
                 Panel parent,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 java.lang.String fullWidth,
                 java.awt.Color color)
        Parameters:
        rowHeight - the height of each row, specified as an algebraic expression of a menu component
        parent - the panel this panel will reside upon.
        x - the integer x coordinate this panel should appear on its parent panel
        y - the integer y coordinate this panel should appear on its parent panel
        fullWidth - the entire width of the panel. In general, intended to be greater than the shown width, determined at run time by the space on the grid allotted to this panel.
        color - the background color for the box when editable

    • Method Detail

      • addFreeComponent

        public boolean addFreeComponent​(MenuComponent comp)
        The ListPanel stores elements in a vertical list. This element will be added at the end.

        This method calls addComponent(MenuComponent, int) to store the component.

        Overrides:
        addFreeComponent in class Panel
        Parameters:
        comp - the component to be added
        Returns:
        returns whether the add was successful

      • addToGrid

        public boolean addToGrid​(MenuComponent comp,
                         int x,
                         int y)
        The ListPanel stores elements in a vertical list. The specified component will be inserted at its y location in that list, displacing other elements if necessary. The x-value of the component will be discarded.

        This method calls addComponent(MenuComponent, int) to store the component.

        Overrides:
        addToGrid in class Panel
        Parameters:
        x - an unused value. Included so this method can override the super method.
        y - the location on the list that the component should be stored
        comp - the component to be added to this panel's grid
        Returns:
        whether the addition of the component was successful

      • removeFromGrid

        public boolean removeFromGrid​(int x,
                              int y,
                              boolean resize)
        The ListPanel stores elements in a vertical list. If there is an element at the given y-value, it will be removed. The x-value is unused.

        This method calls removeComponent(int, boolean) to perform the deletion.

        Overrides:
        removeFromGrid in class Panel
        Parameters:
        x - an unused value. Included so this method can override the super method.
        y - where on the list the component should be deleted from
        resize - whether the grid should check for a resize after the deletion.
        Returns:
        whether the component at the specified list index (y-value) was removed

      • addComponent

        public boolean addComponent​(MenuComponent comp,
                            int listIndex)
        Inserts a component to the list at the specified index. Displaces other elements if necessary.
        Parameters:
        comp - the component to be added
        listIndex - the index of the vertical list to add the component at
        Returns:
        whether the component was successfully added
        See Also:
        removeComponent(int, boolean)

      • removeComponent

        public boolean removeComponent​(int listIndex,
                               boolean pull)
        Removes the component at the specified index, if any.
        Parameters:
        listIndex - the index of the vertical list to remove from
        pull - whether this deletion should pull successive elements down one index
        Returns:
        whether the component was successfully removed #see addComponent(MenuComponent, int) #see clearComponents()

      • getListLength

        public int getListLength()
        The components in the list are saved in Panel.grid. Thus, calling this method returns the height of that grid.
        Returns:
        the height of the grid, or the length of the list held by this panel

      • clearComponents

        public void clearComponents()
        Clears all held components in the grid from this list.

      • render

        public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                   int xx,
                   int yy,
                   int ww,
                   int hh)
        Draws on the graphics object to represent this ListPanel. The ListPanel changes its PanelPlus.fullHeight at render time to have each row drawn at the proper rowHeight. Render can also create dummy null values in the grid to space out the rows properly.
        Overrides:
        render in class PanelPlus
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object to draw on
        xx - the x-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        yy - the y-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        ww - the width on the graphics image that this component is given
        hh - the height on the graphics image this component is given
